column4: Anyone know a software to recover files from a compact flash card, that have already once been overwritten?
That depends. Has the whole card been re-written with new data?
Pretty much the whole card, yes..
Then no. If only the file system pointers have been re-written there is a chance. If the data areas have been re-written, no chance.

Basically, if you have a 1G card with 1000 pics on there, if you delete the pics, there is a good chance of recovery. If you then write over the whole card with 1G data, the original data is lost ... forever.

Hmm.. I see that if it's been overwritten, recovery gets a lot more difficult. But how about the image bank. I saw it copying the images there, but later I wasn't able to find the files, so I suspect that it stopped (=didn't write the allocation table) because of low batteries.
If the files are really important, and have been written to media, bit not overwritten, there is a good chance of recovery. Whether that media is your hard drive or a pen drive.
I suppose there are utilities which can scan media for Jpeg headers then interpret file ends.
which will spit the results as jpegs.
the media is a 2.5" hard drive. And the files are NEF files, not JPG:s so it makes it a bit more difficult.. (NEF = Nicon Raw)
How important is it to recover them?
Are we talking thousands of Dollars/Pounds?
No, only two days of holiday photos (volcano w. lava etc...). So would be nice to have them, if possible, but..
In that case, open sample raw files with hexedit. See if they have some identifiable start/end. Then point hexedit at your hard drive, search for strings.
Thanks.. Does nano/kate work as a HEX editor? what would?
sudo sptitude install hexedit. At command line hexedit
